verses.text: The Mighty One, God the LORD, speaks and summons the earth from the rising of the sun to its setting.
verses.comment: God is depicted as the just Judge calling the whole world to witness. The title 'God the LORD' (El Elohim, Yahweh) emphasizes His supreme authority.

verses.text: Out of Zion, the perfection of beauty, God shines forth.
verses.comment: Zion (Jerusalem) is described as the center of God's manifest glory, prefiguring the place of true worship to come. See Ps. 132:13-14.

verses.text: Our God comes and does not keep silent; before Him is a consuming fire, and a mighty tempest surrounds Him.
verses.comment: The fire and storm recall God's awesome presence at Sinai, underlining His holiness and purity which are later fulfilled in Christ’s final judgment.

verses.text: He calls to the heavens above and to the earth, to judge His people:
verses.comment: Heaven and earth are summoned as witnesses in the divine courtroom; compare with Deut. 4:26.

verses.text: "Gather to Me My faithful ones, who made a covenant with Me by sacrifice."
verses.comment: Sacrifice and covenant are key; the faithful are those united to God through a sacrificial covenant, foreshadowing the new and everlasting covenant.

verses.text: The heavens declare His righteousness, for God Himself is Judge. Selah.
verses.comment: Even the heavens bear witness to God's perfect justice. The term 'Selah' signals a pause for reflection.

verses.text: "Hear, My people, and I will speak; O Israel, I will testify against you. I am God, your God.
verses.comment: God addresses His own people in a unique covenant relationship—He speaks not to the world, but to those bound to Him by faith and worship.

verses.text: I do not rebuke you for your sacrifices, or for your burnt offerings, which are ever before Me.
verses.comment: God does not reject authentic worship, but points to the need for right intention and inner transformation—a theme emphasized by Christ.

verses.text: I will not take a bull from your house or goats from your folds.
verses.comment: Material offerings alone are insufficient; God desires the spirit of sacrifice rather than mere ritual.

verses.text: For every beast of the forest is Mine, the cattle on a thousand hills.
verses.comment: God already owns all creation; human offerings do not increase His wealth but express obedience and gratitude.

verses.text: I know every bird of the mountains, and all that moves in the field is Mine.
verses.comment: God’s sovereign knowledge and possession of creation is stressed, showing all life depends on Him.

verses.text: If I were hungry, I would not tell you; for the world and all it contains is Mine.
verses.comment: Unlike pagan gods, the LORD does not need sustenance from men; true worship acknowledges His sufficiency.

verses.text: Do I eat the flesh of bulls or drink the blood of goats?
verses.comment: Sacrifice is symbolic—God does not literally need food, pointing forward to the perfect spiritual sacrifice anticipated in the New Covenant.

verses.text: Offer to God a sacrifice of thanksgiving, and fulfill your vows to the Most High.
verses.comment: Thanksgiving and faithfulness are greater than ritual. A grateful, obedient heart pleases God above ritual observance.

verses.text: Call upon Me in the day of trouble; I will deliver you, and you shall glorify Me."
verses.comment: God desires a relationship of trust, where His people rely on Him and give Him true honor through faith and worship.

verses.text: But to the wicked God says: "What right have you to recite My statutes or take My covenant on your lips?
verses.comment: Religious words without obedience are condemned here, emphasizing the need for inward faith and moral life as required by the true Church.

verses.text: For you hate discipline, and you cast My words behind you.
verses.comment: True acceptance of God includes loving His correction and keeping His word, as taught by Christ and the apostles.

verses.text: If you see a thief, you are pleased with him; and you associate with adulterers.
verses.comment: Sinful alliances corrupt the soul and are opposed to God's will—purity in conduct is essential.

verses.text: You give your mouth free rein for evil, and your tongue frames deceit.
verses.comment: Speech reveals the heart. Christ also teaches the importance of pure words (Matt. 12:36-37).

verses.text: You sit and speak against your brother; you slander your own mother's son.
verses.comment: Even hidden sins such as slander are under God’s judgment; fraternal charity is a sign of godliness.

verses.text: These things you have done, and I have kept silent; you thought that I was like yourself. But now I rebuke you and lay the charge before you.
verses.comment: God’s patience is not approval. Justice will be revealed in due time; a prophetic warning applies to all who presume upon His mercy without repentance.

verses.text: "Consider this, you who forget God, lest I tear you apart, and there be none to deliver.
verses.comment: Divine judgment is real and total for those who reject Him. A sober warning to return to God, reflected in later New Testament warnings (Heb. 12:25).

verses.text: The one who offers thanksgiving as his sacrifice glorifies Me; to the one who keeps his way I will show the salvation of God."
verses.comment: Thanksgiving and upright living reveal true faith and worship. The 'salvation of God' is fully revealed in Christ, who fulfills all the promises of Scripture and perfects worship by His sacrifice.
